data.title: Sequoia & Kings Canyon National Parks (U.S. National Park Service)
data.text:
Online Mapping Tools

Sequoia & Kings Canyon Park Atlas

This interactive atlas allows you to explore the geography of the parks. You can find a wide variety of information, including visitor facilities, wilderness regulations, and natural resources. Use the atlas to create custom maps. Start with the base topography layer; click on layer visibility to choose layers to add to your map (e.g., ranger stations, shuttle stops, overlooks); then save a digital version or print a copy to bring to the park.

CalTrans Quick Map

Use this interactive California highway map tool to find rest areas, areas of traffic congestion, highway construction zones, and chain control areas outside the parks. For chain control information in the park, please see park alerts or visit our Current Conditions page.

Download the Official Map & Guide

Visit the National Park Service map page for the most recent version of the map of Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks, The Official Map and Guide includes a map of the parks, a map of surrounding areas and highways leading to the parks, a driving mileage table, and other useful information. The Official Map and Guide is also available at park entrance stations. Translations are available for the Official Map and Guide.

Guide en Français

Informationen auf Deutsch

Guia en Español

Guida in Italiano

简体中文指南

Area Maps, Hiking Maps, Backcountry Trail Maps

Are you going on a short hike or ski around the Giant Forest or Grant Grove? Will you take a longer day hike? Visit the online store of our cooperating partner, the Sequoia Parks Conservancy (SPC) or purchase a map once you arrive. Some maps are also available for sale at Sequoia Parks Conservancy stores at the Foothills, Lodgepole, and Kings Canyon visitor centers, and the Giant Forest Museum.

For more detailed topographic maps for backcountry trips, please check the SPC online store, or visit the US Geological Survey's (USGS) maps website. Here, you can download 7.5 minute quadrangle maps of the parks for free, or you may purchase maps.

Campground Maps

Foothills area campgrounds: Potwisha, and Buckeye Flat

Mineral King area campgrounds: Atwell Mill, Cold Springs

Lodgepole area campgrounds: Lodgepole, Dorst Creek

Grant Grove area campgrounds: Azalea, Sunset, Crystal Springs

Cedar Grove area campgrounds: Canyon View, Moraine, Sheep Creek, Sentinel

Please visit our Camping page to learn more about these areas and for seasonal hours of operation.

U.S. Forest Service Maps

Maps for sequoia groves, recreaton districts, and much more for Giant Sequoia National Monument & Sequoia National Forest can be found here.

An interactive map for the Inyo National Forest is also available. The Inyo National Forest is located on the east side of the parks and is a several hour drive from the developed areas on the west side of Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks.

Overview Map of California National Parks
